body: Excluding the "skip half only" and "skip all types" cases, there's around 15 tests which have various combinations of these types. I think it wouldn't be the best use of our time to create groupings for these 15 tests, esp. since many of them will be fixed in the near term. Thoughts?
body_html: Excluding the "skip half only" and "skip all types" cases, there's around 15 tests which have various combinations of these types. I think it wouldn't be the best use of our time to create groupings for these 15 tests, esp. since many of them will be fixed in the near term. Thoughts?
body_text: Excluding the "skip half only" and "skip all types" cases, there's around 15 tests which have various combinations of these types. I think it wouldn't be the best use of our time to create groupings for these 15 tests, esp. since many of them will be fixed in the near term. Thoughts?
